data.title: Hitting meta-s in markdown preview view raises an exception
data.body:
```
Uncaught TypeError: Object #<MarkdownPreviewView> has no method 'save'
```

/cc @maddox

data.title: Tab drop position indicators don't clear
data.body:
When moving tabs around a bunch I end up with position indicators stuck all over. There doesn't seem to be a pattern or a reason, and redragging the nearest tab clears them.

![base scss - _users_benbleikamp_github_github](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/25792/446378/ad23d0c6-b1d4-11e2-9956-724a379744b7.png)

data.title: Atom does not auto-update when a new speakeasy build comes out.
File finder stuck with "No matches found"
data.body: At some point last week my system got whacky and Atom wasn't indexing anything for the file finder. Other things were being weird too so I restarted my computer and it was fixed, but @nathansobo asked me to open an issue so that Atom could provide better information about why it was failing.

data.title: Clean up sync/async method names in fs-utils.coffee
data.body: Sync methods should be marked as such, instead of async methods.

data.title: Atom freezing on github/github
data.body:
I'm able to reliably get Atom to freeze with these files open in github/github:

![settings_controller rb - _Users_benbleikamp_github_github](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/25792/433545/6319d8a0-aed6-11e2-9d29-147293e92478.png)

Before this I did the following things:
1. Open ~/.atom/config.cson
2. Delete all theme related preferences
3. Refresh ~/.atom/config.cson
4. Refresh github/github project
5. Switch to settings_controller.rb
6. Freeeeeeze

data.title: Double-clicking between word and non-word selects both
data.body:
In Sublime when I click on a word, it selects _just that word_, even if the cursor is on other words. This is useful when adding a new argument in a method and replacing some other text elsewhere (which I tried to show in the gif below).

Related to this, it seems like double click the word in the parents is including the preceding `(`, which is not right.

![cursor_aggro](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/64050/433249/18682f30-aec4-11e2-8099-04f895cf9c72.gif)

data.title: Focus moves away from Dev Tools on Window deactivate => activate
data.body:
## Repro Steps:
1. Open the Dev console
2. Focus the JS console
3. Cmd-Tab away to the browser
4. Come back, start typing, expecting that you'll be typing sweet sweet JavaScript
5. Crap I just typed all over my document

data.title: :lipstick: all the things
data.body:
/cc @nathansobo 

part one of upcoming doc fixes

data.title: Syntax highlighting doesn't work across restarts
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. open project, open a few files
2. quit atom
3. re-open project, files open but are not syntax highlighted

If I close the file and re-open it, it is syntax highlighted. Just started with last release.

data.title: "find" autocompletes from buffer
data.body: It'd be awesome if after hitting `meta-f` you could type a word and trigger `autocomplete:attach` to autocomplete it with suggestions from the buffer, similar to how you can autocomplete in a buffer itself. Small Emacsism that I miss.

data.title: Don't spellcheck code in Markdown files
data.body: ![Screen Shot 2013-04-24 at 5 20 14 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/64050/422967/f39d2746-ad3d-11e2-94da-f5ed7c6084fa.png)

data.title: Know when to foldem
data.body:
This PR bases folds on markers. Previously, folds were tracked in the display buffer with a custom data structure that had a lot of duplication with the marker code. Now, to create and track folds, we create markers with a class of "fold" on the buffer. The markers also have a display buffer id so that folds aren't shared between edit sessions for the same buffer.

This PR also improves marker behavior around undo and redo, ensuring that events are never triggered before the buffer change event is emitted and always restoring the ranges of markers to the state they had before the change being undone / redone. I take advantage of this behavior to restore the selection range around undo/redo automatically, allowing the transaction code in edit session to be simplified.
- [x] Unify DisplayBuffer's handling of fold creation / destruction with its buffer change handling code.
- [x] Make it possible to create markers with attributes
- [x] Make it possible to query for markers based on attributes and other properties such as startRow
- [x] Make marker API object-oriented (you're currently forced to do everything with the serializable marker id, which is annoying)
- [x] Base all tracking of fold ranges on markers with the 'fold' class
- [x] Restore folds when operations that invalidated their markers are undone
- [x] Restore ability to destroy a fold by clicking on it
- [x] Ensure that fold markers from one edit session don't result in folds in another edit session

---

For another pull request:
- Add invisible folds
- Allow fold preview lines to be freely edited
- Allow folds to be copied/cut and pasted
- Serialize folds across refreshes

data.title: atom command only works if Atom.app is in /Applications
cmd+t showing "No matches found" without me typing anything
data.body:
Another cmd+t issue, different from the infinite "Indexingâ€¦" in #509.

![atom - _Users_benbleikamp_GitHub_github](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/25792/417737/f30d59e8-ac77-11e2-8238-8a4ab259bcd0.png)

Now when I open Atom (`atom .` from Terminal, usually) I press cmd+t and get this "No matches found" message.

No errors in console. Refresh doesn't fix it. Have tried uninstalling and reinstalling Atom, no luck.

data.title: Fast pass
data.body:
These changes reduced the load time with no open editors on my machine from `~650ms` to `~515ms`.
- [x] Precompile theme `.less` files to `.css`
- [x] Precompile theme `.cson` files to `.json`
- [x] Load TextMate bundle preferences asynchronously like grammars
- [x] Install `atom` executable asynchronously
- [x] Defer a few requires here and there
- [x] Install folders into `~/.atom` directory asynchronously

data.title: Change status block tag
data.body:
The block status commenting has changed. It's now:

```
### STATUS ###
```

You can continue to apply descriptions if you like:

```
### STATUS: A bunch of words describing why life is the way it is. ###
```

Regular block tags are unaffected:

```
###
Public: this does absolutely nothing for documentation.
###
```

data.title: Leave Markdown files alone when trimming whitespace
data.body:
In GFM it's perfectly valid (and sometimes necessary) to end a line with two whitespaces, then line break. This spits out a <`br/>` instead of a closing `

`. I noticed most grammar manipulation works around `editSession.getGrammar().scopeName`. I'm not totally convinced that using `scopeName` is better than `name` in this (or other) cases. For consistency, I can change it, I just happen to think `GitHub Markdown` is easier to remember than `scope.gfm`. Though I'd like to hear thoughts one way or the other.

data.title: Support hyperlinks
data.body:
- [x] Add [hyperlink helper](https://github.com/textmate/hyperlink-helper.tmbundle) bundle
- [x] Support pattern names with embedded groups (i.e `markup.underline.link.$2.hyperlink`)
- [x] Support grammars with an `injectionSelector` value
- [x] Add command to open current link (`ctrl-O`)

data.title: "Indexingâ€¦" forever on github/github
data.body:
When I open `github/github` I seem to get "Indexingâ€¦" indefinitely. I've reinstalled Atom a few times, and sometimes this fixes the problem, but for the past week it's been stuck in this state.

Sometimes it magically fixes itself, but it is _hours_ after opening Atom.

No JavaScript errors in console, refreshing doesn't help, and everything else seems to be working normally.

data.title: Async grammar includes
data.body:
:rotating_light: Almost Done :rotating_light: 

This fixes issue #505. Whenever a grammar is added / removed, any grammars that include it are updated and their buffers are re-tokenized.

There's one more thing to do: I'm currently updating grammars when their included grammars are added or removed, but I _also_ need to update them if any grammars they include are _updated_. This will allow for transitive cases, like reloading an ERB file if the SQL grammar is loaded, because the Ruby grammar includes the SQL grammar inside of certain kinds of here-doc strings.

@kevinsawicki This is pretty similar to what we discussed last Thursday evening. I'll finish out the transitive include case tomorrow.

data.title: Swap out Markdown render logic with module
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/github/atom/issues/501

I think a render pipeline isn't a bad idea, actually. I think the next piece to add is @mention transformation, and repo/PR truncation. But that's for later.

data.title: Lithium task list
data.body:
- [ ] Large file support
- [x] Config UI
- [x] Install packages from http://github.com/atom 
- [x] Transition to atom-shell
- [ ] Hex/Gist/GZip Editor (abstraction on reading/writing file data)
- [x] Injection Selectors (injected grammars)
- [x] Add GitHub API

data.title: Async grammar loading doesn't handle includes
data.body: Loading grammars async can fail for grammars that include other grammars that have not been loaded yet.

data.title: Properly handle contentName in TextMate grammars
Support injection grammars
data.body:
Would love some review on this.

Specifically targeted getting the PHP grammar working for issue #387 

The new PEG for scope selectors is based on the grammar documented [here](https://github.com/textmate/textmate/blob/master/Frameworks/scope/src/parse.cc#L4-L11).

data.title: Counts after paths wrong in command panel
data.body: The number of matches per path shown in the command panel are wrong since it uses the number of child operation elements which fluctuates as operations are rendered lazily as you scroll.

data.title: Cursor dances where header links should be in Markdown
data.body:
![cursor_dance](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/64050/389347/8cbc1c94-a702-11e2-8b88-9008b5e284ba.gif)

It actually looks way worse IRL.

I also think we should just not call out to the GitHub API just to render markdown. I mean I get that we want the 100% totally honest thing, but I'm sure we could find an offline/local npm module that'll do it.

data.title: Crash parsing zip file
data.body:
I got the following crash trying to use the [unzip](https://github.com/nearinfinity/node-unzip) module.

Not sure if it is related, but this module does use the [setImmediate](https://github.com/NobleJS/setImmediate) module.

/cc @zcbenz 

Run the following from the dev tools for a zip file that exists on disk:

``` javascript
require('fs').createReadStream('/Users/kevin/github/node-ls-archive/spec/fixtures/one-file.zip').pipe(require('unzip').Parse())
```
